definitions.definition: To regress ; to slip backwards or revert to a previous, worse state.
examples: He felt better for a little while, before his condition started to backslide .

definitions.definition: To shirk responsibility ; to renege on one's obligations or commitments .
To revert back into a life of sin after being saved .

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To regress ; to slip backwards or revert to a previous, worse state.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To shirk responsibility ; to renege on one's obligations or commitments .
( Christianity ) To revert back into a life of sin after being saved .
